definition: to make a false countercharge
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
to bite/to nip
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: It’s funny how people’s obsessions come back to bite them.
sentences.chinese: 稀奇的是，執着的人們如何反咬一口。

sentences.english: Give the world the best you have and you ll get kicked in the teeth .
sentences.chinese: 當你把最寶貴的東西獻給世界時，你會被反咬一口。

sentences.english: They will turn on us at the first sign of weakness.
sentences.chinese: 一有弱勢，他們就會反咬一口。

sentences.english: The farmer showed his mercy to the snake and was bite by it.
sentences.chinese: 農夫對蛇起了憐憫之心，結果被蛇反咬一口。

sentences.english: Give the world the best you have and you'll get kicked in the teeth.
sentences.chinese: 把最寶貴的東西獻給世界，你就會被反咬一口。

sentences.english: History shows that the assistance the US gives to any of these countries end up backfiring in everyone's face.
sentences.chinese: 從歷史上看，美國幫助的國家往往在最後反咬一口。

sentences.english: Give the world the best you have and you will get kicked in the teeth.
sentences.chinese: 當你把最好的東西獻給世界時，你反而會被反咬一口。

definition: lit. to strike with a muckrake (idiom), cf Pigsy 豬八戒|猪八戒 in Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记; fig. to counterattack/to make bogus accusations (against one's victim)
the guilty party files the suit/the thief cries thief
to bite the hand that feeds one (idiom)
to accuse falsely
to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
to fall out with sb and become hostile
to frame sb (by planting sth on them)
to throw stones at sb who fell down a well (idiom); to hit a person who is down
harboring unfathomable motives (idiom)
to use (sb) as a tool
to extort under false pretenses/to blackmail/to bluff/to defraud
to harbor evil intentions (idiom)
lit. to try to steal a chicken only to end up losing the rice used to lure it (idiom)/fig. to try to gain an advantage only to end up worse off/to go for wool and come back shorn
pinyin: tou1 ji1 bu4 cheng2 shi2 ba3 mi3

definition: to make a false countercharge
lit. to destroy the bridge after crossing the river (idiom)/fig. to abandon one's benefactor upon achieving one's goal
to harbor evil intentions (idiom); concealing malice
